main event: A bright metallic object was observed in the western sky over Bellbrook, Ohio for 10-12 minutes on March 29, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a bright metallic object reflecting sunlight, changing direction and speed several times during the observation.
The object was at a high altitude and disappeared from view in a few minutes.
The witness reported that a number of people in the Bellbrook area also saw the same object at the same time.
A second report was made on March 30, 1965 about a similar bright object seen around 10:15 PM, moving from east to west and then disappearing.
The object was described as triangular in shape and about the size of a quarter when viewed.
